newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile 1996 copper exports rise to 2.9 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Chile 1996 copper exports rise to 2.9 mln tonnes.

text.p: Chile reported copper exports rose 23 percent to 2.95 million tonnes last year from 2.41 million tonnes in 1995, said government research body Comision Chilena del Cobre.
Despite the surge in shipments, the value of Chile's copper exports fell 11 percent to $6 billion as the result of the sharp fall in red metal prices last year, said the report.
Although the report did not give details of production, output last year was boosted by the start-up of the El Abra mine and the completion of an expansion at the huge Escondida pit.
Exports of refined copper increased 14 percent from trhe previous year to 1.6 million tonnes.
Bulk copper exports, which include concentrates and cement, climbed 35.3 percent to 1.12 million tonnes.
Copper blister exports were up 27 percent at 227 tonnes.
Molybdenum concentrates exports slumped 35 percent over the last year to 2.2 million tonnes.
